concepts.name: Poor sleep habits
concepts.description: Inadequate sleep patterns leading to mental and physical health issues, prevalent among college students due to academic and social pressures.

concepts.name: Bedtime patterns
concepts.description: Distribution and consistency of students' sleep schedules, used as a key variable to identify late-night behavior clusters.

concepts.name: Internet access patterns
concepts.description: Digital footprints from education management systems reflecting students' online activity timing, used as proxy data for sleep behavior analysis.

concepts.name: Behavioral characteristics
concepts.description: Multi-dimensional campus behavior profiles (e.g., study, social, dining patterns) used to correlate with sleep habits.

concepts.name: Bayesian networks
concepts.description: Probabilistic graphical models used to explore causal relationships between behavioral dimensions and sleep patterns.

concepts.name: Data-driven approach
concepts.description: Methodology leveraging institutional data (e.g., access logs) instead of self-reported surveys to avoid biases and scale analysis.

concepts.name: Probabilistic mixture model
concepts.description: Statistical framework modeling bedtime distributions as mixtures of latent clusters to identify late-night students.

concepts.name: Social desirability bias
concepts.description: Tendency for survey respondents to report socially acceptable behaviors (e.g., 'good' sleep habits) rather than actual patterns.

concepts.name: Campus-behavior data
concepts.description: Multi-source behavioral data (e.g., library, dining, Wi-Fi usage) from educational management systems for holistic student profiling.

concepts.name: Predictability testing
concepts.description: Validation process assessing the ability to forecast sleep patterns using behavioral and digital footprint data.

methods.name: Poisson-based mixture model
methods.description: Clustering algorithm using Poisson distributions to model bedtime frequency and identify late-night student clusters.

methods.name: Bayesian networks
methods.description: Probabilistic modeling technique to infer relationships between behavioral dimensions and sleep habits from campus data.

methods.name: Behavioral profiling
methods.description: Multi-dimensional analysis of campus activity data across eight behavioral dimensions to characterize student routines.

methods.name: Predictability testing
methods.description: Statistical validation of sleep pattern prediction accuracy using behavioral and digital footprint features.

methods.name: Data-driven identification
methods.description: Methodology leveraging institutional system logs (e.g., Internet access) to infer sleep patterns without self-reporting.
